Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a month ago, i read the flyclient paper or try to, but a much simpler nSPV appears in my mind and a month later i am near to testing an html wallet that is almost as secure as a fullnode and as fast to get started on as an electrum client. basically the best of both worlds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the other day, i heard MORTY was diff stranded due to someone boosting diff 50000x and by the next day i have a new -ac_adaptivepow option that solves the problem of diff stranding for all low hashrate chains. and in the world of millions of blockchains, most all of them will be low hashrate. there is no need to use PoS just to be able to be sure to keep a chain moving. from a technical point despite some issues with PoW, a 100% PoW chain is really the best

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: over last 6 years i have learned a lot and now we have a team that is leveraging my experience

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the latest libnspv improvements was done by blackjok3r, who came up to speed in a matter of days

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so i am feeling actually quite positive about the state of things. the marketing has improved quite a lot from the brown sheet days, this cannot be denied

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we dont do silly partnerships anymore

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so now it is just a matter of time
